content: Hey all, so jmgao proposed a change to the android libstd that uses some internal android mechanisms to validate file descriptions are used correctly. They outline that it is somewhat of a breaking change for certain constructs, such as File::from_raw_fd(22).into_raw_fd(). I'm inclined to land it with the relnotes tag, but I'm not sure the proper process here. (It'd be nice if we had a notification group for the android target I suppose)
An MCP may be the appropriate decision point here, or even FCP since this is a user-visible change.
It's a good idea to bring libs into it, yeah
this issue was nominated and labelled with T-libs and T-compiler, checked with nikomatsakis to see if we want it for this T-compiler weekly meeting and it seems like we don't for now
cc @pnkfelix just in case you wonder why is not included in the agenda :)
I'm not an expert on Android, but I do have some knowledge.
I would like to take a look at the change. This doesn't sound like something we should be doing.
@Josh Triplett Probably best to comment on the PR itself, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/74860
